intro: Browallia elata, commonly known as the purple browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30-60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers range in color from white to deep purple, often with a contrasting yellow or orange throat. Browallia elata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
